hackathon-description-text: I am very pleased to announce that we will be holding the first ever Cisco Practice Hackathon at Softchoice Launch 2015.  Five teams will have approximately 7 hours to complete their projects, and then will be scored by a panel of judges.  The winning team will be guaranteed passes to Cisco Live 2015 in San Diego, CA!
hackathon-eligibility: Softchoice Employees employed before Dec 1, 2014 are eligible for prizes.  All Softchoice Employees are eligible to participate.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The grand prize winning team will be guaranteed passes to Cisco Live 2015 in San Diego, California!
The Second Place team will win a one hour round-table session with either Kevin Wright or the Softchoice Cisco BU (team's choice) within two months after Launch.
The Third Place team will win a thirty minute round-table session with either Kevin Wright or the Softchoice Cisco BU (team's choice) within two months after Launch.
Jabra is sponsoring the Hackathon, and will be selecting their favorite for this prize, which will be a headset, chosen by the winners.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 Harbour Square, Toronto, ON M5J 2G4, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the project reflect current industry trends? Is the project innovative and forward thinking?
Is the project thought provoking?  Does the project leave you thinking "I hadn't thought of doing that before" or "I didn't even know that was possible"?
Would customers find this project compelling?  Is there a positive monetary consequence to implementing a project like this?
Is the project a realistic one?  Would it be too complex to manage, or too expensive to implement.  Would a customer's culture be a limiting factor?
The documentation prepared for the project is evaluated on its aesthetic appeal.  Consistent fonts, layout, diagrams.  Not having documentation gets a 0.
Does the documentation prepared for the project represent the project accurately?  Are any major elements left out?
Is the writing style easy to understand?
Did everyone have a part to play in the project?
How representative of the Softchoice Culture was the team in question?

hackathon-location-address: 1 Harbour Square, Toronto, ON M5J 2G4, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Private Hackathon event held in January at Westin Harbour Castle in Toronto for all the Cisco nerds who work at Softchoice Corporation.
